intro: Romulea linaresii subsp. abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian romulea, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces small, grass-like leaves and has a compact growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
